trans-unit.source: Enables declarative access to XML data for data binding.
In a partial-trust sandbox, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> fails when it does not have permissions to access the given data.
For more information about partial trust security, see [WPF Partial Trust Security](~/docs/framework/wpf/wpf-partial-trust-security.md).
<xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> exposes the following ways to access [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] data.
You can embed inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data using the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> class.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property to the <xref:System.Uri> of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data file.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A> property to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> performs a full refresh of all bindings when a <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.NodeChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs.
There are no optimizations for specific nodes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.IsAsynchronous%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `true` by default, which means that the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> retrieves data and produces the collection of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] nodes asynchronously by default.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider"></xref> class.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The base URI.

Prepares the loading of either the inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] or the external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] file to produce a collection of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] nodes.
The execution is either immediate or on a background thread, based on the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.IsAsynchronous%2A> property.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> methods of the base class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> to use as the binding source.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> exposes the following ways to access [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] data.
You can embed inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data using the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> class.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property to the <xref:System.Uri> of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data file.
You can set this property to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> performs a full refresh of all bindings on when a <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.NodeChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs.
There are no optimizations for specific nodes.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property is set, then any inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data is discarded.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A> property is set, then the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property is cleared and any inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data is discarded.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> object to refresh: <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlNamespaceManager%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath%2A>.
When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh%2A> is recommended.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> to use as the binding source.
The default value is `null`.

Indicates that the initialization of this element has completed; this causes a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh"></xref> if no other <xref href="System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh"></xref> is outstanding.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether node collection creation will be performed in a worker thread or in the active context.
`true` to perform node collection creation in a worker thread; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source"></xref> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider>.
`true` if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlSerializer"></xref> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlSerializer%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider>.
`true` if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath"></xref> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider>.
`true` if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] data file to use as the binding source.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> exposes the following ways to access [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] data.
You can embed inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data using the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> class.
You can set this property to the <xref:System.Uri> of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data file.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A> property to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property is set, then any inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data is discarded.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A> property is set, then the <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A> property is cleared and any inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data is discarded.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> object to refresh: <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlNamespaceManager%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath%2A>.
When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh%2A> is recommended.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data file to use as the binding source.
The default value is `null`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> used to run <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath"></xref> queries.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> object to refresh: <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlNamespaceManager%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath%2A>.
When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh%2A> is recommended.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*mappingCollection*
An <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlNamespaceMappingCollection>.
To refer to a <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlNamespaceMappingCollection>, use the [Markup Extensions and WPF XAML](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/markup-extensions-and-wpf-xaml.md).
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager"></xref> used to run <xref href="System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath"></xref> queries.
The default value is `null`.
Gets the inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] content.
This property is used by the parser to compile the literal content of the embedded [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] data island.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*elementDataRoot*
Required.
The single root element of the enclosed data island.
Without a single root, the `x:XData` is invalid as a data source.
*elementData*
Optional.
XML that represents your data.
Any number of elements can be contained as element data, nested elements can be contained in other elements, and so on, subject to the general rules of XML.
The inline [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xml-md.md)] content.
Gets or sets the `XPath` query used to generate the data collection.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.SelectNodes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method handles the `XPath` expressions from the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.XPath%2A> property.
`XPath` functions are not supported.
For `XPath` expression information, see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.SelectNodes%2A> documentation and some examples provided in the Example section.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> object to refresh: <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlNamespaceManager%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath%2A>.
When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh%2A> is recommended.
The `XPath` query used to generate the data collection.
The default is an empty string.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The base URI.
